electricity that is produced by applying heat to something, often two different metals that absorb the heat differently: Physicists at the university figured out how to boost the potential of thermoelectricity by using metal, heat, and magnetic fields to produce energy. His work focuses on thermoelectricity as a way to generate electricity from geothermal sources in Iceland.
